704906f-a.text:
Hicks Street (right), north from Pineapple to Fulton Streets (general view northwest), showing in the background, the Squibb's and Eagle Storage buildings; beyond which are the Brooklyn and Manhattan Bridges. Also shown, is a vague outline of Manhattan. The streets from fore to background, are Orange, Cranberry, Middagh Streets, and etc. At the left, is Willow Street.
June 15, 1933.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
704906f-a.folder: Hicks Street & Pineapple Street, Brooklyn, NY

704917f-a.text:
Hicks Street (right), west side, north from Pineapple to Orange Streets, showing a view across the roofs of houses bounded by Hicks, Willow, Pineapple and Orange Streets. Pineapple Street is in the foreground. The row of 4-story houses and the 6-story apartment house in the top center are on Orange Street. Willow Street is in the upper left-hand corner. The photograph was taken from the St. George Hotel.

June 15, 1933
P.L. Sperr
NO REPRODUCTIONS
704917f-a.folder: Hicks Street & Pineapple Street, Brooklyn, NY

704918f-a.text:
95 Hicks Street, adjoining the N. E. corner of Pineapple Street. This house was built in 1840 and was known as the John Wiley House, then at 85 Hicks Street; later
the number was changed to 95.
1922
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection
704918f-a.folder: Hicks Street & Pineapple Street, Brooklyn, NY

706282f-a.text:
55-71 Pineapple.Street, north side, between Hicks and Henry Streets. The frame buildings in this view were razed to make way for a 6-story apartment house, called the "St. George Arms".
April 1925.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
706282f-a.folder: Pineapple Street & Hicks Street, Brooklyn, NY
